ProfessionalSummary:
A user-experience designer with proven ability to add value through empathetic and problem-solving
design. Experience improving user interactions for the web, applications, and software technologies in
industries such as Manufacturing, Financial, Higher Education, Nonprofit, Municipal, and Government.

EducationDetails.Text:
Bachelor of Fine Arts: Graphic Design, 2009
Central Michigan University - Mount Pleasant, MI

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Information Technology; and Marketing (Brand Management).    ~~~~~~~   has 8 years of work experience, with 5 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 3/1/2019, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 6 months:
	Title: Global UX Lead for Dematic
Starting on 10/1/2014, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 3 years and 6 months:
	Title: UI/UX Designer and Project Manager for AKEA Web Solutions, LLC, AKEA Accessibility Partners
Starting on 7/1/2016, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 14 months:
	Title: Project Manager for ScaleUp Education Partners
Starting on 2/1/2014, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 23 months:
	Title: Marketing and Communications Director for Mount Hope Church
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Global UX Lead for Dematic), but was not in management in the most recent role as UX & Brand Marketing Consultant for Edify Management LLC.

Positions.Description:
Remote, US


Combining a knowledge of brand marketing and product design, Edify Management supports brands and
products from idea to business. Providing product and service development, brand identity design, along with customer-centered approaches to product market fit. Current and past clients include personality brands,
media companies, event and promotional companies, restaurants, and software startups.

Leading global UX efforts, collaborating with Product Managers to refine requirements and create usability
test criteria. Lead global design system initiative, and style guide creation. Advocate and provide guidance for user experience processes and practices.

Collaborate with Product Owners and Product Managers to refine requirements and create usability test
criteria. Produce design deliverables for product stakeholders, create usability test scripts, and effectively
communicate research findings.

(Contractor)


Collaborated with decentralized UX design teams and Product teams. Provided support for requirements
definition and worked primarily on creating a product style guide for featured enterprise software.

(Contractor)


Provided problem solving design for the Atmosphere Connect mobile application while on the Global Digital
Services team. Focused on IOT and Connected technologies through UCD, interaction design, and interface
design, we worked with R&D, industrial designer to test and modify durable interface designs. As this was a

My responsibilities include: gathering and understanding business & user requirements, creating user profiles,
providing information architecture diagrams and user flows, building detailed wireframes, coordinating design,
creating innovative concepts, and working directly with developers to create client-facing prototypes.

Michigan, US


Remote Project Manager position in which I helped to facilitate Legislative and Statewide Initiatives;
Responsibilities included creating project plans, updating and recording project progress, communications
plans, overseeing deliverables and documents. I worked directly with the Project Lead to ensure that the scope of each project was on schedule and within budget.

At Mount Hope Church, I was responsible for the Marketing and Communications Department. I managed the marketing and communications efforts to help both ministries and departments to stay on path with the vision,
messaging, and branding of Mount Hope Church. The position was very hands-on with the maintenance of day-to-day operations for this large nonprofit organization. Some of the regular and weekly duties involved but
were not limited to: Marketing and Communications Strategy, Planning and Budgeting, Video Production duties
(weekly), Ad Buying, Web Analyst duties, and Social Media Management.

John Hancock Enterprise Applications Division, IT: Project Managed development of websites. Managed on/off
shore resources to coordinate deployments and manage web requests from other business divisions. Also,
acted as a liaison between the Creative Services team and on/off shore teams to execute internal/external web and application projects. Also partnered with the Creative Services team to assist with the design and layout
process by recommending functionality, interface solutions, and documented business requirements.

Findings.Message: Neither an email address nor a phone number were found in the contact information. Recruiters have no electronic way to contact you so your resume is extremely unlikely to get you a job.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
An email address was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include an email address.
A phone number was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include a phone number.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
